title: U.S. price difference between legal and illegal cannabis as of January 2016 , by state
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Average price per ounce in USD on the Y-axis for 6 different States for 2 groups Dispensary price, and Street price that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 2 groups, Dispensary price had the highest Average price per ounce in USD for State Michigan and Street price had the lowest Average price per ounce in USD for State Oregon.
The maximum Average price per ounce in USD for Dispensary price that was found in State Michigan was 1.41 times larger than the minimum Average price per ounce in USD observed in State Oregon.
Averaging all 2 groups Dispensary price, and Street price, the State Michigan is the maximum Average price per ounce in USD and Oregon is the minimum Average price per ounce in USD.
yAxis: Average price per ounce in USD

max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 6 different States on X-axis for 2 groups Dispensary price, and Street price. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Average price per ounce in USD.
For State Michigan, Dispensary price had the highest Average price per ounce in USD 301.0 among the 2 groups and in Oregon, Street price had the lowest Average price per ounce in USD 191.0.
For State Michigan, Dispensary price had the highest Average price per ounce in USD among all 6 States and it has the lowest Average price per ounce in USD in State Oregon.
There is a gap of 87.0 between the highest and lowest Average price per ounce in USD found for Dispensary price in State Michigan and Oregon.
Among all 2 groups, Dispensary price had the gap of 87.0 between the maximum and minimum Average price per ounce in USD observed in State Michigan and Oregon respectively.
Averaging all 2 groups Dispensary price, and Street price, the State Michigan is the maximum Average price per ounce in USD and Oregon is the minimum Average price per ounce in USD.
